name: You Can Dance! (No Safari Edition)
description:
Note: Due to security protocols with Hic et Nunc that prevents loading the dance data and music files, this piece will not display on Safari. It should be fine on Android devices and in Chrome or Firefox on laptops/desktops.

--

Colorful figures dance to a mellow beat in this generative p5.js piece. Dancer patterns and color sequences are unique with each viewing. 

This piece features sound! Turn up your volume for the complete experience.

Click or tap to start. Click or tap to pause and unpause.

More information:

Dance movements are derived from annotations made available through Google's AIST++ project, licensed under CC BY 4.0. For more information, visit https://google.github.io/aistplusplus_dataset/factsfigures.html

Google's AIST++ project is a machine learning research effort based on the AIST Dance DB, which is itself a non-commercial project. No assets from the AIST Dance DB were used in the creation of this piece. For more information about AIST, visit: https://aistdancedb.ongaaccel.jp/

The music featured in the piece was created by the Clay Heaton.
